stepAnswer: The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the ZIP values.
stepTitle: For Query $$1$$, Taylor enters SELECT Street, ZIP FROM Customers. For Query $$2$$, Taylor enters SELECT Street, ZIP FROM Customers ORDER BY $$2$$.\n
stepBody: How does the use of ORDER BY $$2$$ change the appearance of the query results?
answerLatex: The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the ZIP values.
choices: The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show ZIP values that begin with the number $$2$$.
The rows showing the query results for Query $$1$$ can appear in any order, while the rows showing the query results for Query $$2$$ will show in ascending order based on the ZIP values.
The query results for Query $$1$$ will show without any error message, while Query $$2$$ will show an error message.\n
